alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 3:55AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL VERMILION AND NORTHEASTERN CHAMPAIGN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 AM CDT... At 354 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rantoul, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Rantoul, Thomasboro, Gifford, Ludlow, Royal, Penfield, Flatville, and Armstrong. This includes Interstate 57 between mile markers 243 and 257. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
